stanza.line: Let those who are in favour with theirstars
Of public honour and proud titlesboast
Whilst I whom fortune of such triumphbars
Unlooked for joy in that I honourmost
Great princes favourites their fair leaves spread
But as the marigold at the suneye
And in themselves their pride lies buried
For at a frown they in their glorydie
Is from the book of honour razedquite
And all the rest forgot for which hetoiled
Then happy I that love and am beloved
Where I may not remove nor be removed
